Module net.automatalib.util
Package net.automatalib.util.partitionrefinement

Class Valmari.RefinablePartition

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.automatalib.util.partitionrefinement.Valmari.RefinablePartition
  • Enclosing class:
    Valmari
    public static class Valmari.RefinablePartition
extends Object
    A refinable partition data structure. It maintains a partition {A0, A1, ..., Asets - 1} of the set {0, 1, ..., items - 1} for some integer constant items.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field Description
      int[] elems
      Contains 0, 1, ..., items-1 in such an order that elements that belong to the same set are adjacent.
      int[] end
      This field and first indicate the segment in elems where the elements of a set are stored.
      int[] first
      This field and end indicate the segment in elems where the elements of a set are stored.
      int[] loc
      Tells the locations of elements in elems.
      int[] mid
      Divides the segment of a set to the subsegments of marked and unmarked elements.
      int sets
      Tells the number of sets.
      int[] sidx
      Maps elements to the indices of the sets that the elements belong to.

    • Method Summary

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Field Detail

      • sets

        public int sets
        Tells the number of sets. This value is 0-indexed, so there exist sets + 1 partition classes. -1 indicates an empty partition.

      • elems

        public final int[] elems
        Contains 0, 1, ..., items-1 in such an order that elements that belong to the same set are adjacent.

      • first

        public final int[] first
        This field and end indicate the segment in elems where the elements of a set are stored. That is, As = {elems[f], elems[f+1], ..., elems[l−1]}, where f = first[s] and l = end[s].

      • mid

        public final int[] mid
        Divides the segment of a set to the subsegments of marked and unmarked elements. Let f = first[s] and l = end[s]. Then A's = {elems[f], ..., elems[mid[s]−1]} and the unmarked elements are {elems[mid[s]], ..., elems[l−1]}.

      • end

        public final int[] end
        This field and first indicate the segment in elems where the elements of a set are stored. That is, As = {elems[f], elems[f+1], ..., elems[l−1]}, where f = first[s] and l = end[s].

      • loc

        public final int[] loc
        Tells the locations of elements in elems. That is, elems[loc[e]] = e and loc[elems[i]] = i.

      • sidx

        public final int[] sidx
        Maps elements to the indices of the sets that the elements belong to. That is, e ∈ Asidx[e].
